articles.description: Liverpool's spending spree has put head coach Arne Slot under increased pressure to repeat title success, says BBC Sport chief football writer Phil McNulty.
articles.title: Liverpool's Premier League spending spree has increased pressure on Arne Slot

articles.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on singer Tom Grennan with his predictions for the opening round of Premier League fixtures.
articles.title: Premier League opening weekend predictions: Chris Sutton v singer Tom Grennan

articles.description: All the latest from manager news conferences as the Premier League returns on Friday with Liverpool v Bournemouth.
articles.title: Premier League returns: News conferences including latest on Isak

articles.description: Wayne Rooney was involved in transfer sagas in his playing career and says in his new podcast it will be hard for Alexander Isak to stay at Newcastle.
articles.title: Alexander Isak: Wayne Rooney says it is difficult for striker to stay at Newcastle

articles.description: Diogo Jota's family are expected to be at Anfield on Friday for Liverpool's Premier League opener at home to Bournemouth.
articles.title: Diogo Jota's family expected to attend Liverpool tribute at Anfield

articles.description: BBC Sport looks at Moses Itauma's rise through the heavyweight ranks and the hype surrounding him as he prepares to face Dillian Whyte in Saudi Arabia.
articles.title: Moses Itauma vs Dillian Whyte: Time to believe the hype? Young Briton hits big stage with Saudi Arabia fight

articles.description: Enzo Maresca wants Chelsea to sign a new central defender to replace the injured Levi Colwill - but the club continues to seek an "internal solution".
articles.title: Chelsea: Enzo Maresca at odds with club over Levi Colwill replacement

articles.description: We ask 32 BBC Sport football pundits to predict who will win the Premier League title, and which clubs will finish in the top four this season.
articles.title: Premier League predictions 2025-26: BBC Sport pundits pick their top four

articles.description: Runaway world number ones England will have to buck a losing trend if they are to win a home World Cup, with a host of overseas raiders and neighbouring rivals eyeing an upset.
articles.title: Women's Rugby World Cup: England lead contenders for tournament

articles.description: World champion Luke Littler reaches the New Zealand Masters quarter-finals and Luke Humphries is also through, but admits he is "out of sorts".
articles.title: New Zealand Masters Darts: Luke Littler through, Luke Humphries unhappy with form
